title: The Rat King's Crown
description: A massive, deliberate blockage of 'shining refuse' has critically jammed the main arterial drain of the High Ward. Scout teams sent to clear it report organized resistance and 'voices in the dark.' The party must navigate the effluent tunnels, breach the barricade made of stolen noble wealth, and confront the Rat King—a horrifyingly intelligent, augmented escapee from Concordat-era experiments who demands a life-price for the city's flow.

turns.narrative: The primary sewers of Warden-Keep are a sprawling labyrinth of weeping stone, rusted iron grates, and the suffocating smell of ancient, undisturbed decay. The blockage ahead is not merely accumulated trash; it is a meticulously constructed, structural dam built entirely from the stolen silver, jewelry, and polished bone of the Upper Ward.
turns.choice_a: Navigate the effluent flow (Con Save DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: You grit your teeth and wade waist-deep into the dark sludge. You manage to keep your footing in the oily water, successfully avoiding the toxic sickness lurking within the sluggish, contaminated flow.
turns.choice_b: Apply a sweet-smelling oil to your mask
turns.consequence_b: You smear a thick paste of concentrated jasmine oil under your nose. The overwhelming floral scent completely masks the harsh ammonia, keeping your head incredibly clear and your stomach stable.
turns.convergence: You finally reach the edge of the cavernous main cistern, where millions of small, yellow eyes reflect your light, watching you in absolute silence from the shadows overhead.

turns.narrative: The structural 'dam' is built entirely from the stolen wealth that the High Ward didn't realize it had lost. You see gold rings, silver spoons, and even a heavy ceremonial mace expertly woven into the sludge to provide load-bearing support. This is engineering, not hoarding.
turns.choice_a: Inspect the markings on the silver (Investigation DC 12)
turns.consequence_a: You wipe a tarnished silver platter clean. You instantly recognize the pristine crest of House Valerius—this wasn't opportunistic theft, it was a highly targeted, organized raid on a specific noble vault.
turns.choice_b: Sunder the blockade with a heavy pick (Strength DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: You bring a heavy pickaxe down on the keystone of the dam. The structure shatters, releasing a massive torrent of trapped water alongside a deafening, incredibly angry chorus of rat squeaks.
turns.convergence: As the water rapidly recedes, pulling the silver with it, a massive albino rat, easily the size of a fully grown mountain lion, steps slowly into the center of the light.

turns.narrative: The Rat King does not look natural. It wears a grotesque crown of fused copper wire physically bolted into its skull, and a glowing sapphire ring is clamped around its foreleg. Its tail is a heavy silver chain. It doesn't hiss; it projects a voice directly into your mind, thick and resonant.
turns.choice_a: Offer a tribute of dried meat (Animal Handling DC 13)
turns.consequence_a: You slowly toss a heavily salted slab of high-quality meat forward. The creature's primal hunger momentarily overrides its intelligence; it feeds, and the crushing psychic pressure in your head immediately relaxes.
turns.consequence_b: You brandish an intensely burning torch, sweeping it aggressively. The lesser rats cower in terror, but their King does not flinch. Its red eyes burn with a deeply human, hateful intelligence.
turns.convergence: The Rat King's voice echoes brutally in your skull: 'The surface-men take the sun. We are owed the shine. Balance, little knight. We maintain the balance.'

turns.narrative: The Rat King demands a strict 'Life-Price' for removing the blockage and allowing the city's waste to flow again. It requires either a massive tribute of untarnished silver, or the literal blood of a High Ward citizen freely given. It considers both to be of perfectly equivalent value.
turns.consequence_a: You carefully appeal to its obvious strategic intelligence, convincing it that a cleanly flowing sewer provides better long-term security for its kingdom than a stagnant pool. It slowly agrees to clear the path.
turns.choice_b: Strike at the King's copper crown
turns.consequence_b: You predictably lunge for the visible hardware. The copper crown instantly acts as a defensive focusing lens, blasting your mind with a physical wave of pure, agonizing psychic feedback that drops you to your knees.
turns.convergence: Whether insulted or realizing the negotiation is a stalling tactic, millions of smaller rats begin to swarm the walls, forming a literal, living carpet of vibrating fur and teeth.

turns.narrative: The 'Rat-Swarm' does not attack as individual vermin. It acts as a single, massive organism—a tidal wave of unified hunger that attempts to physically drag you down into the darkest, deepest water of the cistern.
turns.consequence_a: You hurl a highly volatile explosive charge directly into the center of the mass. The swarm is violently scattered in a deafening flash of heat and concussive sound, breaking their coordinated assault.
turns.consequence_b: You quickly identify the slightly larger rats exhibiting the glowing copper wiring. You strike these 'neural nodes' precisely, causing the entire swarm network to instantly collapse in chaotic confusion.
turns.convergence: With the swarm broken and scattered, the Rat King is suddenly left isolated, cornered aggressively against the rusted iron bars of the main sluice gate.

turns.narrative: Cornered, the Rat King rears up onto its hind legs, fully exposing a pale belly horribly scarred by complex human surgical experimentation. This creature is not a magical monster; it is a brilliant, tortured escapee from a laboratory that existed long before the Scourge.
turns.choice_a: Offer mercy and a sanctuary (Persuasion DC 15)
turns.consequence_a: You lower your weapon and speak with genuine calm. The King slowly lowers its head, accepting your mercy. In exchange, it points a scarred claw toward a completely hidden access lever behind the heavy gate.
turns.choice_b: Lethal execution for the good of the Keep
turns.consequence_b: You strike without hesitation, severing the creature's head. You end the intelligent threat once and for all. The leaderless rats scatter immediately, ensuring they will never organize to this degree again.
turns.convergence: Regardless of its fate, you approach the massive creature and retrieve the glowing sapphire ring clamped to its leg. It is deeply enchanted—a 'Band of the Tides.'

turns.narrative: With the main sluice gate finally open, the effluent begins to drain aggressively. Behind the gate, you find the true source of the stolen refuse: a perfectly circular, cleanly bored secret tunnel leading directly under the Royal Bank's deepest vaults.
turns.consequence_a: You carefully investigate the bore-hole. You find undeniable signs of modern, extremely precise excavation equipment. Someone is using the intelligent rat infestation as a perfect cover for a massive heist.
turns.choice_b: Seal the tunnel with rubble (Strength DC 13)
turns.consequence_b: You use heavy iron beams to collapse the tunnel entrance entirely. You ensure that absolutely no future bank heists can be conducted from this specific subterranean angle, securing the High Ward's wealth.
turns.convergence: You finally emerge from a heavy iron manhole near the High Ward's central square, thoroughly soaked in foul sewer-water but undeniably victorious in your objective.

turns.narrative: The High Ward sewage workers, gathered nervously around the manhole, are terrified of your smell but incredibly grateful for the restoration of service. The veteran Head Scout pulls you aside to offer a quiet token of profound appreciation.
turns.consequence_a: You graciously accept a rugged, heavily oiled waterproof cape. It is perfectly designed to help maintain absolute stealth while moving through wet, echoing Sub-Ward environments.
turns.choice_b: Ask for the story of the missing experiments
turns.consequence_b: You press him for rumors. He looks around nervously and whispers about a 'Doctor Vane,' a brilliant, horrifying man who supposedly conducted horrific biological experiments in the deepest pits before the Scourge fell.
turns.convergence: In your pocket, the heavy sapphire ring pulses with a rhythmic, cool energy. It seems to faintly recognize the proximity of the city's central mana-grid.

turns.narrative: The City Council formally summons you. They demand a complete report on the 'Rat Threat' to determine budget allocation. How you frame this intelligence will heavily decide the immediate fate of the sewers and the public's perception.
turns.choice_a: Frame it as a natural infestation
turns.consequence_a: You report it as a simple, unusually large natural blockage. The council immediately orders a general, mundane cleaning. Safety briefly increases, though the underlying, intelligent threat remains thoroughly hidden.
turns.consequence_b: You detail the copper wiring and organized sentience. The council is utterly horrified, immediately ordering a heavily militarized purge of all subterranean life, causing massive panic and plunging ward morale.
turns.convergence: The political maneuvering concludes. The High Ward arterial drain flow is fully restored to 100% operational capacity, removing the immediate civic crisis.

turns.narrative: Before resting, you must make a final decision regarding the highly enchanted 'Band of the Tides' sapphire ring you recovered from the King. It bears noble markings but holds significant magical power that could aid your survival.
turns.consequence_a: You formally hand the valuable heirloom over to the noble house. They are eternally grateful for its return, immediately offering you a highly coveted, permanent seat at their political table.
turns.choice_b: Keep it for its Water-Walking enchantment
turns.consequence_b: You slip the powerful ring onto your own finger. You sacrifice massive political influence, but gain a continuous, highly rare tool that will prove invaluable when navigating the flooded sectors of the wastes.
turns.convergence: With your rewards chosen and the drain flowing clearly beneath the city, the operation concludes. Quest Complete.

conclusion: The High Ward drain is cleared, and the Rat King is dealt with. However, the discovery of his copper-wire crown and the obvious signs of organized, intelligent malice among the vermin prove that the rats are not acting on animal instinct, but on a terrifying, inherited sentience.

risk_matrix.penalty: Disease outbreak. -2 Settlement Health and a loss of -5% Trade income for the next week.
risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed with minor consequences.

unlock_conditions.trigger: Reports of aberrant behavior in the Hollow

mercy_path.description: Offer mercy and sanctuary to Rat King

consequences.random_encounters: Rat King may appear as ally in future conflicts

justice_path.description: Execute Rat King for the good of Warden-Keep

consequences.random_encounters: Rats in city become permanently hostile
